newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU grain crop may exceed 190 mln T, official says.
newsitem.headline: EU grain crop may exceed 190 mln T, official says.

text.p: European Union officials are now estimating the EU grain harvest at possibly 192 million tonnes in 1996, exceeding a previous estimate of 190 million, a senior EU farm official said on Wednesday.
"The official EU estimate should not be far from the (estimate of) 192-193 million tonnes currently circulating among trade and farm organisations," the official told Reuters.
He added that forecasts of sharply higher yields in the EU should push the 1996 crop to "around 192 million tonnes".
The 190 million tonnes figure had been given on August 23 to the EU's cereals management committee meeting in Brussels.
Harvest estimates were expected to be discussed in greater details at last Thursday's grain committee but the discussion was postponed because some member countries were late in providing crop data.
In June, an EU advisory committee put the harvest at 185-187 million tonnes, compared with 174 million in 1995.
Farm and trade sources put the EU grain crop at around 194 million tonnes compared with a revised 1995 crop of 178 million, French maize growers association AGPM said on Monday.
